JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
Functional Description:
The Global Mobile team is responsible for the product strategy, UX/UI and delivery of mobile apps for American Express Card members globally. This includes the Amex Mobile app available on iOS and Android in 18+ markets. 
We are part of the wider Global Digital Experience team within Enterprise Digital & Data Solutions that looks after the implementation of the multi-channel market strategy and development, focused on defining and implementing experiences and products across channels. The team ensures these assets are developed in alignment with the overall business vision, and meet a clear user need. 
We’re looking for a talented and passionate Product Analyst to join our team in Phoenix. The successful candidate will have experience managing digital initiatives and will support the Product Owners in the ideation and development of mobile products and services.
Purpose of the Role:
Product Owner for Global Mobile App
Responsibilities:

Enable cross-functional collaboration with relevant teams
Prioritize and maintain a backlog of features and enhancements consistent with outcome objectives
Appropriately identify and raise risks, challenges, opportunities to advance the team
Translate the product roadmap into well-defined requirements, user stories and acceptance test criteria
Follow scrum practices for product delivery
Create a Product Backlog for tech team 
Partner with design and technology teams to develop, test and deliver the defined capabilities


Technically minded & resourceful – with an appreciation of how to execute mobile initiatives
Proactive and enthusiastic – the successful candidate must be excited about the mobile space and the external environment
Collaborative – our role is largely partnership driven, working with capability owners, local teams and technology partners is vital
Strategic thinkers – showing an ability to support decision making and overall execution approach
Detail oriented – active involvement in backlog development requires a process-driven mindset with a strong attention to detail

“Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.”
